Literature.Title: Murepavadin antimicrobial activity against and resistance development in cystic fibrosis Pseudomonas aeruginosa isolates.

Literature.Title: Chemical Synthesis of a Potent Antimicrobial Peptide Murepavadin Using a Tandem Native Chemical Ligation/Desulfurization Reaction.
Literature.Author: Chaudhuri D, Ganesan R, Vogelaar A, Dughbaj MA, Beringer PM, Camarero JA

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC50=0.125µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=4µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC90=2µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC90=32µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MBC=32µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=0.125µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=0.25µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=0.02µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=0.01µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=>10µM),Escherichia coli K-12(MIC=>10µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=0.008-0.5µM)
